    public static class APICommand.Builder
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      APICommand.Builder()
      Constructor that insists that the command gets at least a status object and a command.
      APICommand.Builder(java.lang.String sshRemoteUserServer)
      Creates a builder that will run the commands remotely.

    • Constructor Detail

      • APICommand.Builder

        public APICommand.Builder()
        Constructor that insists that the command gets at least a status object and a command.

      • APICommand.Builder

        public APICommand.Builder(java.lang.String sshRemoteUserServer)
        Creates a builder that will run the commands remotely. The argument is an IP or host name. Example: user@hostname.lib.ca or user@1.2.3.4. To use this feature you must be trusted by the remote machine. To do that you need to cat the local machine's public key into the authorized_keys file in ~/.ssh
        Parameters:
        sshRemoteUserServer -

    • Method Detail

      • commandLine

        public APICommand.Builder commandLine(java.util.List<java.lang.String> arguments)
        Allows the inclusion of addition command-line arguments to a command.
        Parameters:
        arguments -
        Returns:
        Builder. Usage: APICommand cmd = new APICommand.Builder(status, APICommandTypes.WC).commandLine(new Sting[]{"a","b"}).build();

      • cat

        public APICommand.Builder cat(java.util.List<java.lang.String> data)
        Works like the 'cat' command in Unix, that is, will cats lines of data to the stdin of this command.
        Parameters:
        data - List of Strings for input like what you would cat from a file.
        Returns:
        Builder.

      • echo

        public APICommand.Builder echo(java.lang.String stringIn)
        Works like the 'echo' command in Unix, that is, will echo a single string to the stdin of this command.
        Parameters:
        stringIn - String that you want to echo into this command.
        Returns:
        Builder.

      • build

        public APICommand build()
        Builds the command and returns a reference to it.
        Returns:
        APICommand reference. Usage: APICommand cmd = new APICommand.Builder(status, APICommandTypes.WC).echo("21221012345678").build();
